intro.description: This tutorial guides you through the creation of a business process diagram using BPWME editor

item.title: Create an empty bpwme diagram
item.description: The first thing you will need is a bpwme diagram. If you already have a diagram on your file system that you would like to use, you may skip this step by clicking the "Click to Skip" button. If not, select File > New Diagram and give the new diagram a proper name. Then a diagram file is created automatically, with the bpwme perspective. Notice all diagram files are stored under the directory "Documents and Settings\User\AspireRFID\IDE\BPWME\Specified Name".

item.title: Create an Open Loop Composite Business Process (OLCBProc)
item.description: Now you should have a BPWME editor in your workspace. The next thing to do is creating an Open Loop Composite Business Process (OLCBProc). By default, one OLCB Process should be already existing in the editor with the given name. If not, select OLCBProc on the right side of the editor palette, move the mouse cursor to the editing area and left click on the mouse. You can see an OLCB Process is created. You can edit the id and name in the properties view.

item.title: Create a Close Loop Composite Business Process (CLCBProc)
item.description: You can create a Close Loop Composite Business Process (CLCBProc) by choosing CLCBProc on the right side of the editor palette, just like creating an OLCBProc. Notice CLCBProc can only be putted inside OLCBProc.

item.title: Create an Elementary Business Process (EBProc)
item.description: You can create an Elementary Business Process (EBProc) by choosing EBProc on the right side of the editor palette, just like creating an OLCBProc. Notice EBProc can only be putted inside CLCBProc.
